item.title: Can Faith Kipyegon break four minutes in the mile? Scientists say yes.
item.description: Faith Kipyegon, the fastest female miler in the world, could dip under 4 minutes with an extra boost from pacers.

item.title: How to watch the Oscars on Sunday night
item.description: The 97th Academy Awards will air on ABC and stream on Hulu at 7 p.m. ET. Comedian and actor Conan O'Brien is hosting and Wicked stars Ariana Grande an...

item.title: Trump will address Congress. Why isn't this first speech called a State of the Union?
item.description: Trump will give his first speech to Congress next Tuesday since his reelection. It has characteristics of what Americans call a State of the Union add...

item.title: Hamas rejects Israel's request to extend phase one of Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Hamas says it is not willing to extend the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire, rejecting an Israeli request to delay negotiations on the second phase.

item.title: In the federal court system, law clerks find little recourse for bullying and abuse
item.description: An NPR investigation finds federal judges have enormous influence with few checks on their power. Law clerks and other judicial employees are vulnerab...
